verses.verse: Assurance of God’s Protection (Ps 17.8; 27.5; 31.20) You who live in the shelter of the Most High, who abide in the shadow of the Almighty, (Traditional rendering of Heb Shaddai)
(Ps 142.5) will say to the LORD, “My refuge and my fortress; my God, in whom I trust.”
(Ps 124.7) For he will deliver you from the snare of the hunter and from the deadly pestilence;
(Ps 35.2; 40.11; 57.1; Isa 51.16) he will cover you with his pinions, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness is a shield and defense.
(Ps 23.4; 64.4; Song 3.8) You will not fear the terror of the night or the arrow that flies by day
(v 10|PSA 91:10; Job 5.22) or the pestilence that stalks in darkness or the destruction that wastes at noonday.
A thousand may fall at your side, ten thousand at your right hand, but it will not come near you.
(Ps 37.34; Mal 1.5) You will only look with your eyes and see the punishment of the wicked.
Because you have made the LORD your refuge, (Cn: Heb Because you, LORD, are my refuge; you have made) the Most High your dwelling place,
(Prov 12.21) no evil shall befall you, no scourge come near your tent.
(Ps 34.7; Mt 4.6; Lk 4.10; Heb 1.14) For he will command his angels concerning you to guard you in all your ways.
On their hands they will bear you up, so that you will not dash your foot against a stone.
(Lk 10.19) You will tread on the lion and the adder; the young lion and the serpent you will trample under foot.
(Ps 9.10; 59.1; 145.20) Those who love me, I will deliver; I will protect those who know my name.
(1 Sam 2.30; Ps 50.15; Jn 12.26) When they call to me, I will answer them; I will be with them in trouble; I will rescue them and honor them.
(Ps 21.4; 50.23) With long life I will satisfy them and show them my salvation.
